cs213.photoAlbum.control

Interface ControlInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Controller

    public interface ControlInterface
    ControllerInterface interface. Interface for the class responsible for all the nitty-gritty in the Photo Album application. Performs all data and logic related operations.
    Since:
    01-20-2015
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Amar Bakir

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static User currentUser

        Returns the ArrayList of users.

      • addUser

        boolean addUser(java.lang.String ID,
                java.lang.String userName)
        Adds a new user with the given ID and userName to the list of users.
        Parameters:
        ID - is the user's ID
        userName - is the user's name
        Returns:
        True on success, false on failure (user already exists).

      • deleteUser

        boolean deleteUser(java.lang.String ID)
        Deletes a user with the given string ID from the user list.
        Parameters:
        ID - is the user's ID
        Returns:
        True on success, false on failure (user doesn't exists).

      • login

        boolean login(java.lang.String ID)
        Sets the global variable currentUser to the given userID.
        Parameters:
        ID - is the user's ID
        Returns:
        True if successful (user exists), false otherwise.

      • setCurrentUser

        void setCurrentUser(User userID)
        Sets the global variable currentUser to the given userID.
        Parameters:
        ID - is the user's ID

      • getCurrentUser

        User getCurrentUser()
        Gets the currentUser's User object.
        Returns:
        The current user's User object on success, null on failure.

      • createAlbum

        boolean createAlbum(java.lang.String albumName)
        Creates a new album and adds it to the current user's list of albums.
        Parameters:
        albumName - is the name of the new album
        Returns:
        True if the operation is successful, false if the album already exists.

      • deleteAlbum

        boolean deleteAlbum(java.lang.String albumName)
        Deletes an album from the current user's list of albums.
        Parameters:
        albumName - is the name of the new album
        Returns:
        True if the operation is successful, false if the album doesn't exists.

      • getUserAlbums

        java.util.ArrayList<Album> getUserAlbums()
        Returns all the albums the current user has.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of albums or null if the list is empty.

      • getAlbumPhotos

        java.util.ArrayList<Photo> getAlbumPhotos(java.lang.String albumName)
        Gets a list of photos inside of the album with the given name.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of photo objects, null if the album doesn't exist.

      • addPhoto

        int addPhoto(java.lang.String filename,
             java.lang.String caption,
             java.lang.String albumName,
             java.io.File pic)
      throws java.io.IOException
        Adds a photo to the chosen album.
        Parameters:
        filename - is the name of the photo
        caption - is the caption to add to the photo
        albumName - is the album to add the photo to
        pic - is the pictures File object
        Returns:
        1 = Success -1 = Photo already exists in the album -2 = Album doesn't exists
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • recaptionPhoto

        boolean recaptionPhoto(java.lang.String fileName,
                       java.lang.String newCaption)
        Recaptions photo with a new caption.
        Parameters:
        fineName - is the name of the picture to be recaptioned
        newCaption - is the new caption
        Returns:
        return true on success, false on failure

      • movePhoto

        int movePhoto(java.lang.String photoName,
              java.lang.String oldAlbum,
              java.lang.String newAlbum)
        Moves a photo from one album to the other. If it already exists in the new Album the method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        photoName - is the target photo name
        oldAlbum - is the old Album name (Album to move from)
        newAlbum - is the new Album name (Album to move to)
        Returns:
        1 = Success -1 = Invalid old album -2 = Invalid new album -3 = Photo already exists in the new album -4 = Photo doesn't exist in the old album

      • removePhoto

        int removePhoto(java.lang.String fileName,
                java.lang.String albumName)
        Removes a photo from an album.
        Parameters:
        fileName - is the name of the photo
        albumName - is the Album the photo is in
        Returns:
        1 = Success -1 = Album doesn't exist -2 = Photo doesn't exist

      • addTag

        int addTag(java.lang.String fileName,
           java.lang.String tagType,
           java.lang.String tagValue)
        Adds a tag to a photo with a type and value.
        Parameters:
        fileName - is the name of the photo
        tagType - is the Tag's type
        tagValue - is the Tag's value
        Returns:
        1 = Success -1 = specified tag already exists -2 = failure (photo not found)

      • deleteTag

        int deleteTag(java.lang.String fileName,
              java.lang.String tagType,
              java.lang.String tagValue)
        Deletes a tag with a type and value from a specified photo.
        Parameters:
        filename - of the photo
        tagType - is the Tag's type
        tagValue - is the Tag's value
        Returns:
        1 = Success -1 = specified tag doesn't exists

      • getPhotosByDate

        java.util.ArrayList<Photo> getPhotosByDate(java.lang.String startDate,
                                           java.lang.String endDate)
                                    throws java.text.ParseException
        Returns a list of photos whose dates lie between the start and end date.
        Parameters:
        startDate - is the starting date
        endDate - is the ending date
        Returns:
        List of photos that lie in the date range specified (in chronological order) on success, null on failure.
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException

      • getPhotosByTag

        java.util.ArrayList<Photo> getPhotosByTag(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> keys,
                                          java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> tagByVal)
        Returns a list of photos with the given tag values.
        Parameters:
        keys - is a list of tag type:values pairs
        tagsByVal - is a list of values specifies in the input (with no tag type)
        Returns:
        List of photos with given tag values

      • listPhotoInfo

        Photo listPhotoInfo(java.lang.String fileName)
        Finds the photo in the list of Albums and then returns it to be displayed by the calling method.
        Parameters:
        fileName - is the name of the photo to be searched for
        Returns:
        the photo object with properly sorted tags on success, null on failure (photo doesn't exist)

      • logout

        void logout()
        Tries to save the all user's information contained in the user list (albums, photos and tags) and then exits the program.

      • getStartDate

        java.lang.String getStartDate(Album album)
        Returns the photo with the oldest date in a given album.
        Parameters:
        album - to be searched
        Returns:
        name of the photo with the earliest date on success, null on failure.

      • getEndDate

        java.lang.String getEndDate(Album album)
        Returns the photo with the most recent date in a given album.
        Parameters:
        album - to be searched
        Returns:
        name of the photo with the latest date on success, null on failure.
